ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with this course compared to others you have taken was:
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
How would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other F&ES courses you have taken?
Given the course objectives, the level of intellectual challenge of the material covered was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Preparation for COP25.

It was helpful to learn about the specific issues that were going to be discussed at COP25 as well as some very useful practical information about the event itself. The short writing exercises were great in helping us begin to think about our work plan.
The course really helped with finalizing logistics for COP!
COP 25 experience.
This course was extremely helpful in preparing for COP 25.
Got some insights into logistics for attending COP and a good bit of prep on the issues in advance of COP25.
working with a client/country delegation
What it is like to attend an international climate change conference.
I'm not sure that I should answer these questions as I was the TF for the course.
na
I did not learn much in terms of knowledge and skills, but this course was beneficial for preparing and coordinating in the lead up to COP.

narratives.question_text: How well did the knowledge, skills, and insights gained in this class align with your expectations?
comments: Aligned well.
Exactly what I thought.
Very well - this course helped prepare me for the topics covered by COP 25 as well as conference logistics.
Aligned pretty closely with my expectations.
very well
They met expectations. The class prepared me to attend and excel while at COP25.
I'm not sure that I should answer these questions as I was the TF for the course.
na

Felt there were gaps in knowledge on how to navigate COP while there, especially when the TA has experience. Also felt there was a lack in transparency to who received badges and how, and how the application process works.
The course aligned with my expectations fairly well, though I think it could have been more practical.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of the course and how could it be improved?
comments: One very helpful thing with the course was hearing from the business office before we left for COP, so that issues of reimbursement were much more clear than they are in other FES contexts.
Strengths: very well-organized, great speakers invited, all questions were answered promptly Weaknesses: none
The format was helpful. I wouldn't recommend making any changes.
No concerns here, it all seemed to fit the brief.
The COP process is confusing but I think the student TA and faculty did a good job providing information that was useful
It is a good course.
I'm not sure that I should answer these questions as I was the TF for the course.
na
Would have liked to feel more like a cohort attending together. More focus on building that, ie organizing flights and lodging with more intentionality to keep the group together as much as possible.

The course was very helpful for answering student questions and coordinating with other classmates. I would have appreciated more written content, for example, providing answers to common FAQs, past examples of work plans (for a national delegation and for an NGO), links to relevant UNFCCC and COP websites over Canvas (not just showing them on the projector), and instructions about student reimbursements over Canvas (not WhatsApp). It would have been especially useful to give more guidance on creating a work plan, recognizing that each student's work plan will be different.

narratives.question_text: What advice would you give to a student considering taking this class?
comments: Take the initiative - the quality of your time at COP depends on your work and research beforehand. The course guides you, but it's really up to you to put in the time.
Know what you want to do at COP. No one else is going to figure it out for you.
This course is extremely helpful in preparing for upcoming COPs.
Believe them when they say it can be hard to find time to eat at COP.

Be prepared to be a little confused until you get to COP. The TA and faculty do what they can to help facilitate students but it is hard to be fully prepared. Communicate with the organization or country you are working with lots before you get there but be prepared for them to take a long time to get back to you. COP is super hectic and you, as an intern, are not a priority.
It is helpful (and mandatory) for attending COP!
I'm not sure that I should answer these questions as I was the TF for the course.
na
This course is helpful for getting ready for COP, but you will still need to do a lot of research and preparation on your own.
